alert.note: Alert for Newberry; Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 3:32AM EST until January 13 at 10:10AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River Near Camden affecting Kershaw County. Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Marlboro and Chesterfield Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Newberry and Saluda Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Kershaw and Lancaster Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Enoree River at Whitmire. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, River bottomland near and downstream from Whitmire become flooded. At 28.0 feet, The Coleman Aughtry Road along the river becomes flooded. Do not drive into flooded roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 26.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM EST Friday was 29.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 17.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 345 PM EST.
